citation.article-title: Celerinatantimonas diazotrophica gen. nov., sp. nov., a nitrogen-fixing bacterium representing a new family in the Gammaproteobacteria, Celerinatantimonadaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Celerinatantimonas (Ce.le.ri.na.tan′ti.mo′nas. L. adj. celer swift; L. adj. natans swimming; Gr. fem. n. monas unit; N.L. fem. n. Celerinatantimonas the swift swimming unit).
Cells are Gram-negative, motile, polarly monotrichous, facultatively anaerobic, thick rods.
Require mesophilic conditions and seawater salts or NaCl for growth.
The G+C content of the DNA isolated from five strains of the single species is 41.5–44.4 mol% (Table 1).
The genus is a member of the Gammaproteobacteria.
The type and only species is Celerinatantimonas diazotrophica.
Differences between the novel strains and other related families in the Gammaproteobacteria

Taxa: 1, Celerinatantimonas gen. nov. (Celerinatantimonadaceae fam. nov.); 2, Alteromonas; 3, Glaciecola; 4, Colwellia; 5, Thalassomonas; 6, Pseudoalteromonas; 7, Algicola; 8, Ferrimonadaceae; 9, Idiomarinaceae; 10, Moritellaceae; 11, Psychromonadaceae; 12, Shewanellaceae. +, Positive; −, negative; v, variable reaction (dependent on strain).
